item.description:
The wait is over!

We are delighted to announce our upcoming webinar focused on one of the most critical components of [ERPNext, the Stock Module] from an accounting perspective.

This session will help you understand:
‚Ä¢ The accounting impact of various stock movements
‚Ä¢ Key ERPNext features like COA, stock entries, vouchers, and inventory concepts
‚Ä¢ Best practices to maintain accuracy, compliance, and efficiency in your accounting workflows

If you work with ERPNext in finance, consulting, operations, or implementation, this webinar will offer valuable clarity and practical insights.

Date: 18th December 2025
Time: 5:00 PM IST
Speaker: CA Ghanshyam D. Brahmbhatt
Register directly here: https://shorturl.at/BGBsZ

We look forward to having you join us!

item.title: Vision vs. Scope: Why ERP Projects Fail Before They Start
item.dc:creator: Sejal09
item.description:
Let‚Äôs be honest, most ERP projects don‚Äôt fail because of technology. They fail because teams start with a vision but skip the scope.

If you‚Äôve ever asked for a ‚Äúrough budget‚Äù before defining requirements, or struggled to balance fixed cost vs. flexibility, this session is made for you.

Join Aachal Dhote - Enterprise Pre-Sales Lead with years of experience, for an open and insightful session on bridging the gap between customer expectations and partner deliverables.

This conversation is especially for growing enterprises that often:

  • Want fast ballpark budgets, but end up with moving targets
  • Hesitate to pay for discovery or T&M models
  • Have evolving needs but expect fixed costs
    -Prefer trust-based partnerships over rigid contracts
    -We understand, and we‚Äôre here to discuss it openly.

What We‚Äôll Explore Together:

  • Vision ‚â† Scope: Why good intentions aren‚Äôt enough for good estimates.
    -Budget Without Scope: The hidden costs no one talks about
  • T&M vs. Fixed Cost: Finding balance between trust and clarity
    -Discovery Done Right: Quick, affordable ways to define what you really need
    -Managing Change Smartly: How to adapt without endless rework
    -Customer Best Practices: What makes great proposals possible

Let‚Äôs make ERP projects smoother, smarter, and more successful together!

Register here: https://shorturl.at/YsZLM

Access will be shared only with registered participants.

3 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Vision vs. Scope: Why ERP Projects Fail Before They Start

item.title: ERPNext, HRMS & Frappe Framework v16 Release Dates
item.dc:creator: nabinhait
item.description:
We are excited to share the official release dates for Version 16 of ERPNext, Frappe HRMS, and the Frappe Framework.

Beta Release: 15th November 2025

Final Release: 6th December 2025 12th January 2026 (read update here)

Feature Highlights

ERPNext

  • Customizable templates for financial statements

  • Inward subcontracting

  • MRP enhancements

  • Consolidated trial balance

  • Improved default print formats

  • Performance optimisation for accounting reports

  • Serial and batch traceability report

  • Landed cost for stock entries & subcontracting receipts

  • Stock reservation for subcontracting & production

  • Track semi-finished goods via Job Cards

  • POS improvements

  • Enhanced budgeting

  • Asset module refactoring

  • Refactored TDS

  • Stock accounting based on Item / Item Group

  • Separate COGS and Service expense accounting

HRMS

  • Overtime management

  • Arrears & loss-of-pay correction

  • Multi-currency expense claims

  • Employee benefits

  • Leave adjustments

  • Earned leave schedule

  • Holiday list enhancements

Frappe Framework

  • Completely redesigned Workspace (desktop, module cells, navigation)

  • ~2√ó faster performance

  • Enhanced List View: scrollable, resizable columns, unlimited fields, etc

  • Scrollable child tables with sticky columns

  • Custom print formats for reports

  • Role-based field masking

  • Chrome-based PDF converter

We invite all community members to explore the beta, try the new features, and share your feedback.
If you find any bugs, please create an issue in the respective GitHub repository.

Your feedback helps us ship the most stable and refined release possible

Let‚Äôs make v16 the most stable and delightful release yet!

70 posts - 43 participants

Read full topic
item.source: ERPNext, HRMS & Frappe Framework v16 Release Dates

item.title: Introducing Mint - Better Bank Reconciliation for ERPNext
item.dc:creator: nikkothari22
item.description:
Today I‚Äôm happy to announce the launch of Mint, a new open-source app that we created to improve the bank reconciliation experience in ERPNext.

It‚Äôs built using React and is a single page app (/mint). It literally just has one page by the way.

Mint helps you reconcile transactions with ease. It highlights potential matches, autofills relevant information and even allows bulk reconciliation. If you make a mistake, you can easily ‚ÄúUndo‚Äù a reconciliation.

When recording inter-bank transfers, Mint will look for ‚Äúmirror‚Äù transactions and suggest that as well.

You can also set up rules to automatically classify transactions - and this helps users by autofilling accounts and parties.

A lot of effort has gone into refining the experience - the little details - like date pickers can accept natural language input (‚Äú2 days ago‚Äù or ‚ÄúApr 21‚Äù), there‚Äôs fuzzy search on the transactions list, date popups do not jump around when switching between months, account dropdowns show accounts in groups and also offer fuzzy searching.

I have added a lot of documentation and screenshots on the Github repository and a YouTube video (50+ minute long!) is being uploaded now.

Mint is available on Frappe Cloud on private benches.

21 posts - 7 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Introducing Mint - Better Bank Reconciliation for ERPNext

item.title: Announcing the Raven Mobile app
item.dc:creator: nikkothari22
item.description:
The title says it all really, but this has been one of the most requested items on our list ever since we released Raven two years ago.

The native mobile app allows you to refine the UX at standards similar to other popular chat apps - we‚Äôre not quite there yet, but we‚Äôll get there and the native app is a step in that direction.

With the native app, you can now use just one app on your phone for multiple sites. Notifications should also be more reliable (we‚Äôre also going to finally release a push notification relay server dedicated for Raven‚Äôs use case which would also cater to self hosted users). Haptics, animations and interactions should all be much smoother on the new app as well.

You can download the app today:

Apple App Store

Google Play Store

It‚Äôs still in early beta, so please report any bugs and issues you find here on GitHub.

The mobile app requires Raven v2.1.12 or later and Frappe v15.63 or later. (basically the latest versions as of writing this post). To set up your site for Raven mobile, go to Raven on the web app > Settings > Mobile App and click the button to setup the OAuth client.

For folks who are curious about the underlying tech stack, here‚Äôs a brief overview.
The mobile app is built using React Native and uses frappe-react-sdk under the hood.

Since the web app is built using React, we decided to use a monorepo to share code between the two - all type definitions, data fetching hooks, functions are shared between web and mobile. We‚Äôre using OAuth to authenticate users - and hence the OAuth client setup is required as described above.

28 posts - 8 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Announcing the Raven Mobile app

item.title: Announcing Raven v2: now with AI Agents, document alerts and more!
item.dc:creator: nikkothari22
item.description:
If there‚Äôs one thing we‚Äôve worked on the most on Raven for the past few months, it‚Äôs integrations with other Frappe apps.

With Raven, you can now build your own AI Agents to automate routine tasks in ERPNext - all without writing any code. Whether it‚Äôs parsing invoices or expense claims, you can choose how you want to use AI Agents in your setup since it can integrate with any Frappe app.

You can also send notifications for documents within ERPNext like notifying the finance team about an invoice or sending salary slips to employees via bots.

We‚Äôre also introducing a new way to manage channels and user permissions with ‚ÄúWorkspaces‚Äù - making it easier to manage internal teams, customers, or multi-company setups.

Read more about Raven v2 here: Raven v2 by The Commit Company | Frappe Blog

Raven‚Äôs website: ravenchat.ai
GitHub

26 posts - 5 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Announcing Raven v2: now with AI Agents, document alerts and more!

item.title: Frappe Build 2025 is here! üöÄ
item.dc:creator: PalkanP
item.description:
Dear Frappe developers,

We‚Äôre back with another edition of Frappe Build, the developer conference where we dive deep into the framework, share ideas, and learn from experts.

Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned Frappe developer or just starting out, this is your chance to expand your knowledge, attend hands-on workshops, and connect with the vibrant Frappe community.

Why Attend?

  1. Meet fellow devs
    Get to know the product owners and maintainers who are building amazing products. Discover their workflows and thought processes, and get valuable feedback on your projects.
  2. Explore what the community is working on
    With over 1,000 engineers in the Frappe developer ecosystem, there‚Äôs no shortage of innovation. See what the community is building on Frappe, exchange ideas, and get inspired for your next project.
  3. Learn from experts
    Attend expert-led talks and workshops to deepen your understanding of Frappe and open-source development. Whether you‚Äôre looking for tips on best practices or new tools, there‚Äôs something for everyone.

Get involved

  1. Register now to secure your spot and join the fun.
  2. Propose a talk/workshop to share your knowledge and insights with fellow developers.
  3. Become a sponsor to highlight your brand in the Frappe community.

More details coming soon, stay tuned!

In the meantime, let us know what you‚Äôd love to see at Frappe Build 2025.

coworker365.com

Frappe Build 2025

Discover, build, and thrive where innovation meets collaboration with open-source enthusiasts. Join the conversation, fuel your passion, and craft the future with Frappe Framework.

item.title: Introducing New Health App - Marley
item.dc:creator: Sajin_SR
item.description:
Hello everyone, I‚Äôm Sajin, one of the code owners of Frappe Health at earthians.

I‚Äôve got an exciting news to share with you!

We have recently moved the Frappe Health repository to earthians organization on GitHub, meaning we are taking full ownership of the module. In the process, we have also changed the app name from Frappe Health to Marley.

All other things remain the same including the license and our commitment to the healthcare module.

Also, nothing to worry about for the health app users, everything should be managed for sites hosted on the frappe cloud. Self-hosted folks just update the remote url before you do an update.

If you have not tried the app yet, you can easily set up a site on Frappe Cloud.

Many thanks to all our users, community collaborators, and everyone at Frappe for all the love and support, we really want to take Marley Health to new heights! And special thanks to Nabin for completing the move to our org and Suhail for managing things on FC.

We look forward to your valuable feedback and recommendations, please let us know.

Check out the app on GitHub - earthians/marley: Open Source Health Information System.

Thank you all once again! earthians

item.title: A new app for your enjoyment :-)
item.dc:creator: abrefael
item.description:
Hey everyone,
I built a fun and oddly satisfying app that can run on the frappe framework.
It is intended for anyone who wishes to have an active shopping list while already having a running frappe instance.
The app is here
The point of the app is this:
Up until a few months ago I was a heavy Google eco system user. This meant that whenever I‚Äôd go out shopping for grocery, I would open a shared ‚Äúkeep‚Äù checklist, where my wife, at home, could populate ad-hock.
As I decided I wish to de-google my life as much as possible, I tried different types of self hosted ‚Äúshopping lists‚Äù. However, I did not find an app that worked well for our needs.
So I built one myself
What it does?

  1. You can select where you go (i.e.: Market, Grocery store or Other).
  2. You can name you list (e.g.: ‚ÄúBoby‚Äôs birthday party‚Äù for a list dedicated for things you want to buy for boby‚Äôs birthday party)
  3. You have a ‚ÄúTo take‚Äù table, where you insert the actual list of things to buy (the different products are in another list, that is importable ). You can input a quantity and units per product (it‚Äôs something you control on the products list. e.g.: kg, lbs, liter, units in any language etc.).
  4. Whenever an item on the list is checked, it is ‚Äúauto-magically‚Äù moves to the ‚ÄúTaken‚Äù list and the page is saved. This way both you and any other person controlling the list can keep taps over the list (no double inserting (used to happen while using ‚Äúkeep‚Äù). In addition, if you accidentally check anything, you can check it over on the ‚ÄúTaken‚Äù list for it to ‚Äúauto-magically‚Äù jump back to the ‚ÄúTo take‚Äù list*

There is a lot of potential to add features, however, I think that the app is small, effective and useful.
Fill free to use it. I have been using it for the past month, and I am very happy with the way it turned out.

*went shopping yesterday, and I saw some tomatoes. I checked the tomatoes on the list and approached the tomato bin, where the tomatoes where less than exciting‚Ä¶ ( ). I went back to the ‚ÄúTaken‚Äù list, checked them back to the ‚ÄúTo take‚Äù list and went to another vendor)

BTW
it can also change colors

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: A new app for your enjoyment :-)

item.title: Learn VueJS, TailwindCSS and FrappeUI! | #BuildWithHussain
item.dc:creator: buildwithhussain
item.description:
At Frappe, we are building a lot of new products: Frappe Insights, Learning , Builder, and more! They all have one thing in common: the tech stack. Frappe Framework already allows you to build full-stack web applications with low-code and in record time. It is now time to build sleek and modern front-ends with tailored User Interfaces and Experiences. This is where FrappeUI, a set of pre-built UI components and libraries, comes in. FrappeUI is built on top of VueJS.

I am going to conduct a live 4-day training on these topics starting from scratch:

frappe.school

VueJS, TailwindCSS and FrappeUI Training

Learn the foundations to build modern single page applications with VueJS and FrappeUI

(btw 16 out of 25 seats left)

In this training program, I will teach you the foundations you need to build front-end apps with VueJS and FrappeUI. Whether you want to build your own products or want to contribute to Coworker365 Products and Integrations like Frappe CRM, this training is for you!

I will let you in on a secret‚Ä¶

Frappe Framework‚Äôs frontend is being re-written using VueJS and FrappeUI . In my opinion, this is the best time to learn this stack!

Enroll here: Frappe Learning (built on FrappeUI as well )

Hussain

Read full topic

item.title: [Training] Frappe Framework Developer Training + Certification
item.dc:creator: nikkothari22
item.description:
I‚Äôll be conducting a Frappe Framework Training + Certification on Frappe School later this month from May 29th 2024 to 1st June 2024.

We will cover the basics of the Framework - DocTypes, REST APIs, web/portal pages, customisations, reports and dashboards along with some advanced topics like server scripts, real-time events via SocketIO and background jobs.
